item0.title: Laravel Event Projector Released
item0.content_html:
Freek Van der Herten has been working on Laravel Event Projector, a package for event sourcing in Laravel. The first stable version (v1.0.0) is now live! Learn how Event Projector can help you use the event sourcing pattern in Laravel, and how to get started with the new Event Projector package.

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item1.title: PHP 7 Multi-format Streaming Parser
item1.content_html:
PHP 7 Stream Parser is a package by Sergio Ródenas for PHP multi-format stream parsing. Using streams with a pull parser is more efficient in large documents than DOM loading. Learn more about how you can use this package to parser large XML, JSON, and CSV files.

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item2.title: Laravel Dump Server
item2.content_html:
Laravel Dump Server is a Laravel package by Marcel Pociot, which brings Symfony’s Var-Dump Server to Laravel. Check out this awesome new way to debug your Laravel applications!

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item3.title: Twine: String Manipulation, Leveled Up
item3.content_html:
Twine is a stand-alone PHP 7 package by Chris Kankiewicz for string manipulation and comparison with an expressive fluid syntax. Let’s go through a quick overview of the package features and how you can start using it on your PHP projects.

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item4.title: Laravel Relationship Events
item4.content_html:
Laravel Relationship Events is a package by Viacheslav Ostrovskiy that adds extra relationship events to models. Learn how it can help you gain access to relationship events within your associated models.

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item5.title: Upcoming Laravel Events and Meet-ups happening in July
item5.content_html:
Here are some of the Laravel events happening in July of 2018.

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item6.title: Laravel Entity Relation Diagram Generator
item6.content_html:
Laravel Entity Relation (ER) Diagram Generator is a package by Marcel Pociot that lets you generate entity relation diagrams by inspecting the relationships defined in your model classes. Learn how you can create a visual representation of your model columns and relationships.

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item7.title: Laravel Self-Diagnosis Package
item7.content_html:
Laravel Self-Diagnosis is a package by Marcel Pociot that performs self-diagnostics tests on your application. The checks include standard things like setting the ‘APP_KEY’ environment variable when checking out a new project. Learn how you can use this package to diagnose common configuration settings needed to start working on a Laravel application.

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item8.title: Learn Laravel Forge
item8.content_html:
Learn Laravel Forge is new video course on Laracasts teaching you all things Forge, by guest instructor Marcel Pociot! The course consists of over twenty free videos walking you through configuring servers with Laravel Forge.

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item9.title: Building Flexible Axios Clients
item9.content_html:
Recently I set out to improve how I work with APIs in my Vue applications by building a flexible Axios client that I can use in my Vuex actions and one-off components. Let’s briefly go over a few tips on improving HTTP requests on the frontend using Axios.

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item10.title: Eventy: WordPress-like Actions and Filters for Laravel
item10.content_html:
Eventy is a Laravel package by Tor Morten Jensen that brings WordPress-style actions and filters to your Laravel app. Learn about adding actions and filters WordPress-style to your Laravel applications.

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item11.title: Laravel TestTools Adds Dusk Support
item11.content_html:
Laravel Test Tools is a Google Chrome browser extension by Marcel Pociot that enables you to generate Laravel integration tests while using your application. Now you can use the extension to create Dusk test cases!

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item12.title: GitHub Tips and Tricks
item12.content_html:
I’ve compiled a list of my favorite GitHub tips and tricks that I use in my workflow daily. You might be familiar with some or even all of them, but I find that developers new to GitHub and veterans alike might pick up a new tip or two!

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item13.title: GitHub Desktop Dark Mode
item13.content_html:
GitHub announced yesterday that the GitHub desktop application’s latest version, v1.2.4, ships with a beta version of a dark theme. Learn about the latest version of GitHub for Desktop, available on Mac and Windows.

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item14.title: Puphpeteer: A Puppeteer bridge for PHP
item14.content_html:
Puphpeteer by Johann Pardanaud is PHP bridge for Google Chrome’s Puppeteer headless chrome Node.js API. Learn how you can leverage Pupeteer through PHP with this composer package.

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item15.title: Laravel 5.6.26 Released
item15.content_html:
Laravel 5.6.26 was released June 20th with allowing the passing of the recipient name in mail notifications; the table name is now passed to post-migration create hooks, array/collections are now allowed in ‘Auth::attempt()’, and more. Learn more about the new features, changes, and fixes in this release.

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item16.title: Built with Jigsaw – the Ultimate Showcase of Web Sites Built with Jigsaw
item16.content_html:
“Built with Jigsaw” is a gallery of websites made with Jigsaw, and includes helpful articles about using Jigsaw. Learn more about Jigsaw and creating static sites using the familiar Laravel Blade syntax and tools like Laravel Mix.

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item17.title: Laravel Tenancy – Multi-Tenant Package for Laravel
item17.content_html:
Laravel Tenancy is a package by Daniël Klabbers, Paulo Trajano, and Bertrand Kintanar, for making your Laravel application multi-tenant. Learn about getting started with this package and its highlight features.

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item18.title: PHPConsole is a Programming and Live Coding Companion
item18.content_html:
PHPConsole is a neat Windows desktop application GUI for writing, reading, and executing PHP code by Josiah Ovye Yahaya. Learn more about this application that can help beginners learn how to program and is useful for live code presentations.

Visit Laravel News for the full post.

item19.title: Automatically Open Files on Artisan “Make” Commands
item19.content_html:
“Open on Make” is a neat little package by Andrew Huggins that makes it easy to have newly created files open in your editor of choice. When you run commands like ‘php artisan make:controller’, this package will listen for the command and open the file in the editor that you configure.

Visit Laravel News for the full post.
